utils.orientation.quat_conjugate(q)[source]

Calculate the conjugate of Quaternion [1]_

Parameters:

q (ndarray) – quaternion

Returns:

  • q (ndarray) - the conjugate of quaternion multiplication

[1]

`Wiki <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quaternion#Conjugation,_the_norm,_and_reciprocal>’

utils.orientation.quat_multi(q1, q2)[source]

Calculate the product of two quaternion multiplication [1]_ [2]_

Parameters:

  • q1 (ndarray) – quaternion

  • q2 (ndarray) – quaternion

Returns:

  • q (ndarray) - product of two quaternion multiplication

Mathematical expression:

q1 = (s1, v1)

q2 = (s2, v2)

q1q2 = q1 x q2 - q1 · q2 (Cross product minus Dot product)

= (s1 + v1)(s2 + v2)

= s1s2 + s1v2 + s2v1 + v1v2

= s1s2 + s1v2 + s2v1 + (v1 x v2 - v1 · v2)

= (s1s2 - v1 · v2) + (s1v2 + s2v1 + v1 x v2)

= scalar part + vector part

[1]

‘<https://slideplayer.com/slide/16243043/>’

[2]

‘<https://personal.utdallas.edu/~sxb027100/dock/quaternion.html>’

  • N (float) – North axis value

  • U (float) – Upward value

  • D (float) - Downward value

utils.transformation.acc2eul(ax, ay, az, nav='ENU')[source]

Convert acceleration vector with gravity to Euler angle in ENU or NED frame [1]_ [2]_

Parameters:

  • ax (float) – x axis accelerometer

  • ay (float) – y axis accelerometer

  • az (float) – z axis accelerometer

  • nav (str) – navigation frame

Returns:

  • roll (float) - x-axis Euler angle in radians

  • pitch (float) - y-axis Euler angle in radians

  • yaw (float) - z-axis Euler angle in radians

[1]

Page.163, Fundamentals of Inertial Navigation, Satellite-based Positioning and their Intergration, Springer, 2013

[2]

Gimbal Lock explaination <https://www.nxp.com/docs/en/application-note/AN5017.pdf>

  • ay (float) – y axis accelerometer

  • az (float) – z axis accelerometer

  • nav (str) – navigation frame

Returns:

  • w (float) - Quaternion magnitude

  • x (float) - Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) - Quaternion Z axis

utils.transformation.accmag2eul(ax, ay, az, mx, my, mz, nav='ENU')[source]

Convert acceleration vector with gravity and magnetometer value to Euler angle in ENU or NED frame included tilt compensation[1]_

Parameters:

  • ax (float) – x axis accelerometer

  • ay (float) – y axis accelerometer

  • az (float) – z axis accelerometer

  • mx (float) – x axis gyroscope

  • my (float) – y axis gyroscope

  • mz (float) – z axis gyroscope

  • nav (str) – navigation frame

Returns:

  • roll (float) - x-axis Euler angle in radians

  • pitch (float) - y-axis Euler angle in radians

  • yaw (float) - z-axis Euler angle in radians

[1]

Page.163, Fundamentals of Inertial Navigation, Satellite-based Positioning and their Intergration, Springer, 2013

utils.transformation.accmag2quat(ax, ay, az, mx, my, mz, nav='ENU')[source]

Convert acceleration vector with gravity and magnetometer value to Quaternion in ENU or NED frame

  • az (float) – z axis accelerometer

  • mx (float) – x axis magnetometer

  • my (float) – y axis magnetometer

  • mz (float) – z axis magnetometer

Returns:

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

class utils.wireframe.wireframe(nav_frame)[source]

Bases: object

Generate wireframe as IMU model included 8 vertices, 12 edges, and 6 faces [1]_ [2]_

Parameters:

nav_frame (str) – navigation frame

axis color:

Positive of x axis is Red, Negative of x axis is Cyan

Positive of y axis is Green, Negative of y axis is Magenta

Positive of z axis is Blue, Negative of z axis is Yellow

[1]

Cube property references <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cube>

[2]

Github references <https://github.com/DonovanZhu/9DoF_MARG_Madgwick_Filter/tree/master>
